title: Particle motion of a parametric function

content.question: In the xy-plane, a particle moves along the parabola <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C11@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with a constant speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><msqrt> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@387F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> units per second. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>></mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, what is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A2B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> when the particle is at the point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B90@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
